entries.meaning: A rope or cord tied up outdoors to hang clothes on so they can dry.
examples: Hang this towel out on the clothesline for me.

entries.meaning: A structure with multiple cords for the same purpose, such as a Hills hoist.
(Canada, US, informal) The act of knocking a person over by striking his or her upper body or neck with one's arm, as if he or she had run into a low clothesline.

verbs.description: clothesline (third-person singular simple present clotheslines, present participle clotheslining, simple past and past participle clotheslined)

entries.meaning: (Canada, US, informal, transitive) To knock (a person) over by striking his or her upper body or neck with one's arm, as if he or she had run into a low clothesline.
examples: The referee called a personal foul, when he clotheslined the running back.
